    • getSender

      public SchoolUser getSender(@NotNull @NotNull Message message)
      Description copied from interface: MessageService
      Retrieves the sender of a specific message.
      Specified by:
      getSender in interface MessageService
      Parameters:
      message - the `Message` object
      Returns:
      a `SchoolUser` object representing the sender of the message Pre-condition: The `message` must not be null and must have a valid sender associated with it. Post-condition: Returns the `SchoolUser` who sent the specified message.

    • create

      public MessageResponse create(@NotEmpty @NotEmpty String message, @NotNull @NotNull UUID chatId, boolean isHomework)
      Description copied from interface: MessageService
      Creates a new message in a specific chat.
      Specified by:
      create in interface MessageService
      Parameters:
      message - the message content
      chatId - the UUID of the chat
      isHomework - true if the message is related to homework, false otherwise
      Returns:
      a `MessageResponse` object representing the created message Pre-condition: The `message` must not be null or empty. The `chatId` must not be null and must refer to an existing chat. Post-condition: A new message is created and added to the specified chat. Returns a response object with the message details.

    • addAttachment

      @PreAuthorize("hasRole(\'STUDENT\') || hasRole(\'TEACHER\')") public String addAttachment(@NotNull @NotNull UUID uuid, @NotNull @NotNull org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile multipartFile) throws IOException
      Description copied from interface: MessageService
      Adds an attachment to a specified entity.
      Specified by:
      addAttachment in interface MessageService
      Parameters:
      uuid - the UUID of the entity to associate with the attachment
      multipartFile - the file to be uploaded as an attachment
      Returns:
      a string representing the file path or identifier of the uploaded attachment
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error during file upload Pre-condition: The `uuid` and `multipartFile` must not be null. The `multipartFile` must be a valid, non-empty file. Post-condition: The file is uploaded and associated with the specified entity. Returns the file path or identifier.
